solution_line_template: Troy walks to school and back home for a total of {troy_home_to_school} x {trips_per_day} = <<{troy_home_to_school}*{trips_per_day}={troy_daily_distance}>>{troy_daily_distance} meters every day.
Emily walks to school and back home for a total of {emily_home_to_school} x {trips_per_day} = <<{emily_home_to_school}*{trips_per_day}={emily_daily_distance}>>{emily_daily_distance} meters every day.
So Emily walks {emily_daily_distance} - {troy_daily_distance} = <<{emily_daily_distance}-{troy_daily_distance}={emily_extra_per_day}>>{emily_extra_per_day} meters farther than Troy every day.
In five days, Emily walks {emily_extra_per_day} x {num_days} = <<{emily_extra_per_day}*{num_days}={emily_extra_total}>>{emily_extra_total} meters farther.
